title: Piano Question About Kindred's Login Music
body:
Is the low D to B stretch (linked below) in the song even possible? I've been using FB instead of DB because my fingers can only stretch 9 keys, and DB is 10. I've also tried using the right hand to stretch from high A to B, but that's also 10 keys wide. Was the composer able to make the stretch? And, if not, is it possible at all?

http://i.imgur.com/5A4W9yS.png

replies.body:
Hey Arcade Gumiho,

I'm not sure where you found that particular copy of the sheet music but there are mistakes in the version you've posted. I would check the original one at http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/sound-music/RYMr4vFV-kindred-the-eternal-hunters-official-sheet-music 

Hope this helps!

Damn, I wish I'd known about this before I learned the song. Maybe when I have time I'll go back and learn the original composition. Fortunately, they're not too far off.

Thanks, a lot, for the help! It's an honor to have a Rioter answer the question.

EDIT: After looking at both pieces whilst listening to the song, I believe the composition I learned was trying to cater to the lack of a cello (it's a solo ver., persay).

NP! When I wrote Kindred's theme I went pretty all-out in terms of the piano writing. I'm afraid there isn't much room to incorporate the cello part without reducing the density of the original piano part dramatically (or growing an extra arm).

Definitely!

If you're interested in viewing where I got the sheet music from, here's the version I learned of it:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zlot5Unzjjc

I'll, without a doubt, go back and learn thee original composition sometime though.

If you move your hand to the side of the keys instead of on top of them you can pull the two lowest notes down with your pinky and thumb without pushing any other keys down.

I can't imagine that chord has a lot of practicality. That seems really difficult to pull off.
